org.hps.analysis.trigger.util

Class ClusterMatchedPair2019

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.analysis.trigger.util.Pair<Cluster,VTPCluster>
      • org.hps.analysis.trigger.util.ClusterMatchedPair2019

  • public class ClusterMatchedPair2019
extends Pair<Cluster,VTPCluster>
    Class ClusterMatchedPair stores a reconstructed cluster and an VTP bank reported cluster which have been compared for the purpose of cluster matching. It also tracks what the match state of the two clusters is.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      static byte CLUSTER_STATE_MATCHED 
      private byte state 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClusterMatchedPair2019(Cluster reconCluster, VTPCluster vtpCluster, byte state)
      Instantiates a new ClusterMatchedPair object from the two indicated clusters and marks their match state.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Cluster getReconstructedCluster()
      Gets the reconstructed cluster of the pair.
      byte getState()
      Gets the raw state identifier.
      VTPCluster getVTPCluster()
      Gets the SSP cluster of the pair.
      boolean isEnergyFailState()
      Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair failed to not being close enough in energy.
      boolean isHitCountFailState()
      Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair failed to match due to not being close enough in hit count.
      boolean isMatch()
      Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair matched.
      boolean isPositionFailState()
      Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair failed to match due to the cluster positions not aligning.
      boolean isTimeFailState()
      Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair failed to match due to the cluster time-stamps not aligning.
      boolean isUnknownState()
      Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair has no known match state.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClusterMatchedPair2019

        public ClusterMatchedPair2019(Cluster reconCluster,
                              VTPCluster vtpCluster,
                              byte state)
        Instantiates a new ClusterMatchedPair object from the two indicated clusters and marks their match state.
        Parameters:
        reconCluster - - The reconstructed cluster.
        sspCluster - - The SSP cluster.
        state - - The pair match state.

    • Method Detail

      • getReconstructedCluster

        public Cluster getReconstructedCluster()
        Gets the reconstructed cluster of the pair.
        Returns:
        Returns the reconstructed cluster a Cluster object.

      • getVTPCluster

        public VTPCluster getVTPCluster()
        Gets the SSP cluster of the pair.
        Returns:
        Returns the SSP cluster as an SSPCluster object.

      • getState

        public byte getState()
        Gets the raw state identifier.
        Returns:
        Returns the state identifier as a byte primitive. Valid identifiers are defined in the class TriggerDiagnosticUtil.

      • isEnergyFailState

        public boolean isEnergyFailState()
        Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair failed to not being close enough in energy.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the pair match state is an energy fail state and false otherwise.

      • isHitCountFailState

        public boolean isHitCountFailState()
        Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair failed to match due to not being close enough in hit count.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the pair match state is a hit count fail state and false otherwise.

      • isMatch

        public boolean isMatch()
        Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair matched.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the pair match state is a match state and false otherwise.

      • isPositionFailState

        public boolean isPositionFailState()
        Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair failed to match due to the cluster positions not aligning.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the pair match state is a position fail state and false otherwise.

      • isTimeFailState

        public boolean isTimeFailState()
        Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair failed to match due to the cluster time-stamps not aligning.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the pair match state is a time fail state and false otherwise.

      • isUnknownState

        public boolean isUnknownState()
        Indicates whether the recon/SSP pair has no known match state.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the pair match state is unknown and false otherwise.
